Secret Manager¶

bibtutils.gcp.secrets¶

Functionality making use of GCP’s Secret Manager.

See the official Secret Manager Python Client documentation here: link.

bibtutils.gcp.secrets.get_secret(host_project, secret_name)[source]¶

An alias for get_secret_json().

Parameters

  • host_project (str) – the name of the host project of the secret.

  • secret_name (str) – the name of the secret to fetch.

Return type

dict

Returns

the secret data.

bibtutils.gcp.secrets.get_secret_by_name(host_project, secret_name, decode=True)[source]¶

Gets a secret from GCP and returns it either as decoded utf-8 or raw bytes (depending on decode parameter). Executing account must have (at least) secret version accessor permissions on the secret.

Parameters

  • host_project (str) – the name of the host project of the secret.

  • secret_name (str) – the name of the secret to fetch.

  • decode (bool) – (Optional) whether or not to decode the bytes. Defaults to True.

Return type

bytes OR str

Returns

the secret data.

bibtutils.gcp.secrets.get_secret_by_uri(secret_uri, decode=True)[source]¶

Gets a secret from GCP and returns it either as decoded utf-8 or raw bytes (depending on decode parameter). Executing account must have (at least) secret version accessor permissions on the secret.

Parameters

  • secret_uri (str) – the uri of the secret to fetch. secret uri format: 'projects/{host_project}/secrets/{secret_name}/versions/latest'

  • decode (bool) – (Optional) whether or not to decode the bytes. Defaults to True.

Return type

bytes OR str

Returns

the secret data.

bibtutils.gcp.secrets.get_secret_json(host_project, secret_name)[source]¶

Gets a secret from GCP and returns it parsed into a dict. Executing account must have (at least) secret version accessor permissions on the secret. Note: secret must be in JSON format.

Parameters

  • host_project (str) – the name of the host project of the secret.

  • secret_name (str) – the name of the secret to fetch.

Return type

dict

Returns

the secret data.
